title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.32-33 | 22-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Although due to feminine shyness, there were many hindrances to embracing the dear husband, Lord Sri Krishna, the Queens performed that act by seeing him through the eyes.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains verses 32 of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the queens' devotion to Lord Krishna and their expressions of love upon his return.

segments.key_quote: In the material world no one is permanently fortunate however clever one may be.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains verse 33, highlighting the impermanence of material fortune and the importance of surrendering to the lotus feet of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: The spiritual relation with the Lord is so enlivening and resourceful that no one can leave the company of the Lord once having taken shelter of him.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami contrasts the material and spiritual worlds, emphasizing Krishna's eternal youthfulness and the eternal bliss of the spiritual realm, free from the influence of time and material modes.

segments.key_quote: So therefore Bhagavad Gita directs us surrender to the Lord, and in his association you will be able to satisfy your desires completely.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains the concept of living beings as feminine potencies of the Lord, emphasizing the importance of surrendering to Krishna for complete satisfaction and experiencing ecstasy through devotion.
